title.narrative: Costa Rica - NAPPO Workshop ISPM 15 Implementation in the Americas

description.narrative: The United States, through NAPPO, partnered with the Inter-American Institute for Cooperation on Agriculture (IICA) and other regional plant health organizations (including CAN, COSAVE and OIRSA) to hold a workshop in the Americas aimed at enhancing global compliance with the international standard for wood packaging materials (known as ISPM 15) and thereby further reduce the threat of wood and forest pests in trade.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Caribbean - Trinidad Red Palm Weevil on-line training

description.narrative: In 2016 this initiative continued with the same team, training an additional 4 counties namely, Jamaica, Cayman Islands, Belize and Turks and Caicos. To minimize cost and to integrate the use of new technology available each country received: a Weevil Kit containing sample of (died and preserved) Weevils; laminated Red Palm Weevil Identification cards; one DinoLite USB Microscope (from the 2015 budget); and laminated detail instructions for access and use of the DinoLite USB Microscope. Additionally the APHIS IS Trinidad Office, from its 2015 trapping trails in Trinidad, was able to design, build and supply these 4 countries with Red Palm Weevil Bucket traps, and supply pheromone and food bait lures to these countries to conduct their surveillance trapping for 1 year.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Caribbean - Regional Pest Prioritization & PRA Triaining Initiative

description.narrative: The training took the format of train the trainer which sort to test the functionality and validity of the recently developed Regional Analytical Hierarchy Model to ensure that a highly objective basis was maintained, one which can be justified and withstand scientifically scrutiny.

title.narrative: Caribbean - Non Compliance Sensitization Seminar FY17

description.narrative: The Seminar would be to bring together all the industry relevant stakeholders to update and sensitize them on local and international regulations and procedures, ISPMs, role of the packing houses, trade implication resulting from non-compliant shipments, Inspections etc. in an effort to reduce issues of noncompliance to the US.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account

description.narrative: The objective of the seminar was to sensitize the various industry stakeholders, in both Trinidad and Tobago and Dominica, on the rate of interception of non-complaint fruits and vegetables being exported by producers and ways of mitigating and reducing non-complaint shipments. Working closely with in-country stakeholders, APHIS focused on inspections at the ports of entries in the United States and estimated costs associated with shipments that do not comply with U.S. requirements (both quantitative and qualitative), highlighting specific crop problems encountered at U.S. ports of entry, and up to date interception data by commodity / country and introduce the stakeholders toAPHIS's trade requirements database as a step in reducing noncompliance.
